body.script:
var siteAlerts = [{"id":3831,"title":"NYACK PUBLIC SCHOOLS WILL BE CLOSED THRU MAY 15 DUE TO COVID-19. VISIT OUR NEW COVID-19 RESPONSE WEBPAGE FOR ALL UPDATES & HELPFUL RESOURCES","body":"
We will continue to send updates via robo-call, email and text messaging to all District families. All update letters from Dr. Montesano are posted in the new COVID-19 RESPONSE webpage, for reference. All COVID-19 Announcements are also posted in the COVID-19 RESPONSE web page. Please check it regularly.

Our Tech Help Desk has been updated in response to the volume of tech assistance needed by our families in English, Spanish and Haitian Creole. If you have not received a District-issued device and need one for your child's Remote Learning Plan, call the TECH HELP DESK at 845-353-7075 or, use this NEW TECH HELP DESK FORM for quick-access assistance. Click on the link, fill out the form and submit. A tech assistant will contact you within 24 hours:





Nyack Family and Student Technology Help Desk

Soporte Técnico y de Apoyo Digital para la Familia y Estudiantes

Sistèm pou Ede Fanmi ak Elèv yo nan Teknoloji




Thank you for your continued collaboration as we work together to keep all families informed and connected during this unique and challenging time. 

Stay Nyack-Strong!","dateStart":"2020-04-21T00:30:17Z","baseGroupName":"Nyack Public Schools","hash":"pyrHwuksBdcpmVTIe+YpPghuMdRp/C841FM1jeAuHBA=","updateDate":"2020-04-21T00:30:18Z","showInPopup":false}];

img.div: Building Bridges for today's students to cross into tomorrow's world with Equity, Innovation & Optimism

div.h3: Our Music Department has produced a "Lovely Day" video to boost your spirits. It is posted on our COVID-19 RESPONSE page and linked, below:

p.em: Thank you Nyack Public Schools Music Department.

div.h3: April 20th:This COVID-19 RESPONSE PAGE has been created to house important information, improve communication & stay connected with you

em.strong: This web page is a work-in-progress. Please peruse and check regularly for District Updates:
We will continue to send updates via robo-call, email and text messaging to all District families.
Extension of School Closure dates will continue to be posted in the Alert Box located at the top of the District's webpage(s).
All Update Letters from Dr. Montesano are posted in the Superintendent's Update Box, for reference.
Thank you for your continued collaboration as we work together for District Communications during these unique and challenging times.

div.h3: Take a Look & Listen: The April 16th Community Zoom Meeting has been posted

li.a: Zoom Meeting with the Superintendent of Nyack Public Schools-3.pdf

div.h3: United Way of Rockland has published a COVID-19 Community Resource Guide, attached here for your convenience

div.p:
Table of Contents includes:
Food Pantries & Feeding Programs; Grocery Stores & Pharmacies; Testing Locations; Behavioral Health Support Services; Health Insurance and Prescription Assistance; Unemployment Insurance & Pandemic Unemployment; Child Care;Utilities; Housing; Banking & Student Loans

div.h3: On April 13th, a new Tech Help Form was posted to provide quick access to tech assistance in English, Spanish and Haitian Creole

p.strong: to the volume of tech assistance needed by our families in English, Spanish and Haitian Creole.
If you have not received a District-issued device and need one for your child's Remote Learning Plan, call the
TECH HELP DESK at 845-353-7075 or fill out the NEW Tech Help Form located on this page in the TECH SUPPORT Box.

div.h3: On April 7th, a letter from Dr. Montesano was sent to parent/guardians of 7-12 graders regarding cancellation of June 2020 Regents Exams

li.a: 7 de abril actualizacion importante y carta del Dr Montesano.pdf
April 7 Letter to Grades 7-12 Parent Guardians Regarding NYS Regents Exams(1).pdf

div.h3: On April 6th, the NYS Dept. of Education released a series of Emergency Regulations to ease the burdens of educators, students...

p.strong: ... and professionals in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic.
Click on the link below to view NYSED
"Acts on a Series of Emergency Regulations to Ease the Burdens of Educators Students and Professionals in the Wake of COVID-10 Pandemic":

div.p: An initial REMOTE LEARNING GUIDE for PARENTS/GUARDIANS was provided by the District on 4-1-20 that included an initial overview, guidelines and protocols set forth by Nyack Public Schools for all families to use in the first month of extended school closure. As we transition into greater frequency of "Live" (or Synchronous) Learning for all K-12 students, PLEASE EXPECT an ADDENDUM to this REMOTE LEARNING GUIDE to include updated protocols on such topics as expectancies on synchronous & asynchronous instruction, District-endorsed platforms, guidelines for students online learning, scheduling, attendance, grading and testing:

a.title: Nyack Public Schools Remote Learning Guide for Parents 2020.pdf
Guia de Aprendizaje Remoto Para Padres 2020.pdf

li.a: Guia de Aprendizaje Remoto para Padres

span.strong: Helpful Terms for Understanding Our Remote Learning Plan

li.span: Phase 1 = Days 1-10 of Educational Continuity Plan; March 19-31, 2020
Phase 2 = Days 11-15 of Educational Continuity Plan; April 1-8, 2020
Phase 3 = April 9th thru the last day of extended school closure; focus on increased Synchronous/"Live" Learning
Synchronous Learning = Live; Direct Contact between teacher and students; face-to-face online learning with platforms such as Zoom & Google Hangout
Asynchronous Learning = NOT live; Indirect contact with pre-recorded lessons using platforms such as Screencastify, Google Classroom or Seasaw

a.title: Sistèm pou Ede Fanmi ak Elèv yo nan Teknoloji

span.a: an Kreyol: Sistèm pou Ede Fanmi ak Elèv yo nan Teknoloji

p.em: Our Tech Help Desk has been updated in response to the increase of tech assistance needed by our families in English, Spanish or Haitian Creole. Due to the volume of need, we are doing our best to ensure that a tech assistant will contact you within 24 hours of leaving a message or filling out the above form. We thank you in advance for your patience. We are committed to addressing your questions and concerns. Tech Help is on the way.

a.span: Office of Equity, Inclusion & Innovation Page

div.p: WE ARE HERE TO HELP! The School Meal Program provides FREE breakfast & lunch at 2 community locations for pick up on Mondays & Wednesdays:

ul.li: Nyack Center, 58 Depew Ave (Corner of Broadway) - pick up between 9:30 am - 1:00 pm
Waldron Terrace Housing Complex parking lot - from a mobile unit between 10:00-11:00 am

div.p: PLEASE NOTE: As of April 20, distribution of meals are provided 2 days per week instead of daily. Monday Meals will include food for 2 days (Monday-Tuesday); Wednesday Meals will include food for 3 days (Wednesday, Thursday, Friday) at these locations.

p.strong: Gloria Menoutis, District Business Executive, with questions or concerns - 845- 213-9590, OR
CONTACT Your Family Resource Center if you need assistance with meal distribution:

li.strong: Wanda Octaviano, MS FRC - for assistance in SPANISH or English - 845-353-7214
Silvia Falcomer, Liberty FRC - for assistance in SPANISH or English - 845-353-7247
Rachel Berlin, UNE FRC - for assistance in HAITIAN CREOLE or English - 845-353-7268
Jessica Misla, VCE FRC - for assistance in SPANISH or English - 845-353-7291
